revised_title: An Extraordinary Fossil Skull of an Ox, Plica Polonica, and a Large Tumor of the Eye
tldr: The author describes an extraordinary fossil skull of an ox with the cores of its horns, a Plica Polonica, and a large tumor of the eye. The Plica Polonica is a skin fold mentioned in Transactions No 417, and the tumor was caused by a hail injury. The author also shares the story of the woman who had the Plica Polonica and the man with the eye tumor.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Paleontology
